author: John Woodrow Cox
title: Nixon’s big lie
text:
October 15 at 5:16 PM Regarding the Oct. 12 front-page article “ Document trove exposes a Nixon lie about Vietnam ”:
On May 21, 1972, I stood on the east front steps of the Capitol with 17 members of Congress and hundreds of protesters as the United States launched bombing raids over North Vietnam. We believed those air attacks were wrong and wanted President Richard Nixon and the American people to know it.
Today, with the classified documents that former White House insider Alexander Butterfield has turned over to The Post’s Bob Woodward, we now know that Nixon, despite his public comments to the contrary, believed the bombings were ineffective. Here’s what Nixon wrote atop a report from his national security adviser, Henry Kissinger: “We have had 10 years of total control of the air in Laos and [Vietnam]. The result = Zilch.”
If Nixon had ended the Vietnam War in 1972, he would have saved thousands of American lives (and tens of thousands of North and South Vietnamese).
